tag_professor: Tough Grader (3)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (3)  LECTURE HEAVY (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (3)  GROUP PROJECTS (2)  Get ready to read (2)  Participation matters (1)  Caring (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)  Respected (1)
comments: This is probably the strangest course I\'ve done at MUN (and that\'s saying a lot cause I\'m a folklore major) I mean strange in a good way. Topics range from bigfoot to aliens to Atlantis, etc. If you\'re looking for something different and outside of the box then I would recommend this course (only draw back is that there is a group project)

comments: taught way to hard for an intro course and I wasn\'t even a first year when taking it. most people were fourth year or higher taking it for fun but if I was first year and took this I would have left mun. He seems nicer to the arch majors when their in the upper levels of their degree.

comments: Nice guy, but he was hard to reach outside of class and from my experience feedback on my work was very minimal. He posts no notes online so showing up to every class is necessary.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (3)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (3)  LECTURE HEAVY (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (3)  GROUP PROJECTS (2)  Get ready to read (2)  Participation matters (1)  Caring (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)  Respected (1)
stu_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS  PARTICIPATION MATTERS  TOUGH GRADER
comments: Never again. This course was made near impossible due to the inaccessibility of notes and curriculum outcomes. Asking questions doesn\'t resolve confusion if anything it causes frustration, as the materials covered are not consistent with the \'textbook\', notes, lectures, and assignments. Each assignment was a shot in the dark.

stu_tags: RESPECTED  CARING  SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.
comments: One of my faves. Had him a few times and the best by far was forensic. You could tell he was in his element & I LOVED that class. Other classes: I only wish he\'d slow down. He doesn\'t put lectures on D2L which is fine but he goes through the slides so fast that I\'m focused on writing them down and don\'t pay attention to his further clarification.

stu_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS  LECTURE HEAVY
comments: Notes don\'t align and make any sense. The topic for each lecture is very unclear and he moves too fast to get everything down. Slides are never posted and prepping for the midterm doesn\'t even exist.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (3)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (3)  LECTURE HEAVY (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (3)  GROUP PROJECTS (2)  Get ready to read (2)  Participation matters (1)  Caring (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)  Respected (1)
stu_tags: TEST HEAVY  GET READY TO READ
comments: Interesting lectures but exams mainly cover textbook material. The exams were really tough, given questions that you think you know the answers for but the given options aren\'t what you\'d expect. The long answers were easy marks though. Easy questions with options on what one to do and not grade too roughly. Multiple choice and T/F just suck.

stu_tags: GET READY TO READ  LECTURE HEAVY  GROUP PROJECTS
comments: The online lectures are so long, and compounded with extra videos. So much of the course content is so pointless and unrelated to future assessments. If you\'re passionate about archaeological frauds and mysteries you\'ll love this course, if not, this course will be really boring for you.

Tough Grader (3)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (3)  LECTURE HEAVY (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (3)  GROUP PROJECTS (2)  Get ready to read (2)  Participation matters (1)  Caring (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)  Respected (1)
comments: Vaughn is a really good prof. He is actually interested in helping you pass and learn the stuff. He speaks clearly and his quiz are fair and the format is easy although you actually have to read the book because some of the questions come out of left field. I really liked him and I will be taking more classes with him and I recommend him to any one

tag_professor: Tough Grader (3)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (3)  LECTURE HEAVY (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (3)  GROUP PROJECTS (2)  Get ready to read (2)  Participation matters (1)  Caring (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)  Respected (1)
comments: Great prof! Very enthusiastic and laid back, wants his students to do well. Has bi-weekly quizes (20 or so multiple choice - not hard at all) that makes studying for the midterm so much easier. very fair tests. read the textbook and you\'ll do fine!
